section.title: Installing the DNS Service with BIND
section.para: &productname; DNS Service defaults to the BIND back-end if another back-end is not configured for domain name service. BIND will be deployed to one or more control planes clusters. The following configuration example shows how the BIND service is installed.

section.title: Configuring the Back-end
section.para: Ensure the DNS Service components and the BIND component have been placed on a cluster. BIND can be placed on a cluster separate from the other DNS service components.
section.screen:
control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 region-name: region1
clusters: - name: cluster1 service-components: - lifecycle-manager - mariadb - ip-cluster - apache2 - ... - designate-api - designate-central - designate-pool-manager - designate-zone-manager - designate-mdns - designate-client - bind
section.para: When the back-end is configured, add bind-ext to the file network_groups.yml.

step.para: Edit ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/network_groups.yml to add bind-ext to component-endpoints.
step.screen: name: EXTERNAL-API hostname-suffix: extapi component-endpoints: - bind-ext
